body: @jacobsa Each profile line gives n: m [N: M] for a particular allocation stack, where n: m is currently allocated (live) objects, and N: M is all objects. pprof --inuse_xxx uses n: m and pprof --alloc_xxx uses N: M. What I mean by "a snapshot of live data" is really "a snapshot of right now", because those are updated only at each GC.
